research.title: Governance at a Crossroads: Artificial Intelligence and the Future of Innovation in America
research.abstract: This paper explores the potential of dynamic, collaborative public-private governance to foster safe innovation in AI. Drawing from primary research, including interviews with tech industry leaders, U.S. Members of Congress, and staff, and an analysis of 150 AI-related bills introduced by the 118th U.S. Congress, this work identifies emerging areas of alignment between policymakers and industry stakeholders. It proposes a Dynamic Governance Model that brings government and industry together while combining the foresight of ex-ante measures with the adaptability needed to address technological advancements.

research_experience.title: Machine Learning for COVID-19 Detection
research_experience.description: Developed a COVID-19 detection model using deep convolutional neural networks (DCNNs) on chest x-ray images. The model achieved 82.0% sensitivity, 96.5% specificity, 81.5% F-score, and 94.5% accuracy.
